lu.uni.geko.mmtransformer
Class PluginStarter

java.lang.Object
  lu.uni.geko.mmtransformer.PluginStarter

public final class PluginStarter
extends Object

A utility class for installing and starting plug-ins that were created during code generation.

Constructor Summary
private PluginStarter()
          Utility classes should not have a public or default constructor.
 
Method Summary
static void installAndStartGeneratedEditorPlugin(org.eclipse.emf.common.util.URI mmURI)
          Installs and starts the model, edit, and editor plug-ins that were created for the metamodel at the given URI.
private static void installAndStartGeneratedPlugin(org.eclipse.emf.common.util.URI absolutePluginURI, String pluginID)
          Installs and starts the plug-in with the given ID that is located at the given absolute URI.

          Installs and starts plug-ins that were created using the given generator model.

Constructor Detail

PluginStarter

private PluginStarter()
Utility classes should not have a public or default constructor.

Method Detail

installAndStartGeneratedPlugins

public static void installAndStartGeneratedPlugins(org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.GenModel genModel,
                                                   boolean onlyModelCode)
Installs and starts plug-ins that were created using the given generator model. Plug-ins with edit and editor code are only installed and started if onlyModelCode is false.

Parameters:
genModel - the generator model used for code generation
onlyModelCode - whether to install and start only model or also edit and editor code plug-ins

installAndStartGeneratedEditorPlugin

public static void installAndStartGeneratedEditorPlugin(org.eclipse.emf.common.util.URI mmURI)
Installs and starts the model, edit, and editor plug-ins that were created for the metamodel at the given URI.

Parameters:
mmURI - the URI of the metamodel for which the model, edit, and editor plug-ins were already created

installAndStartGeneratedPlugin

private static void installAndStartGeneratedPlugin(org.eclipse.emf.common.util.URI absolutePluginURI,
                                                   String pluginID)
Installs and starts the plug-in with the given ID that is located at the given absolute URI.

Parameters:
absolutePluginURI - the absolute URI of the plug-in without its ID
pluginID - the ID of the plug-in
